dublinCore.dc:title: 113 HR 1992 EH: Israel QME Enhancement Act
dublinCore.dc:rights: Pursuant to Title 17 Section 105 of the United States Code, this file is not subject to copyright protection and is in the public domain.

form.official-title: To amend the requirements relating to assessment of Israel’s qualitative military edge over military threats, and for other purposes.

section.text: This Act may be cited as the Israel QME Enhancement Act.

section.header: Amendments to requirements relating to assessment of Israel’s qualitative military edge over military threats

subsection.text: Section 201 of Public Law 110–429 (122 Stat. 4843; 22 U.S.C. 2776 note) is amended—

paragraph.text: in subsection (a), by striking an ongoing basis and inserting a biennial basis; and

subparagraph.text: in the heading, by striking Quadrennial and inserting Biennial; and

in the text, by striking Not later than four years after the date on which the President transmits the initial report under paragraph (1), and every four years thereafter, and inserting Not later than one year after the date of the enactment of the Israel QME Enhancement Act, and biennially thereafter,.

paragraph.text: Not later than 90 days after the date of the enactment of this Act, the Secretary of State shall submit to the appropriate congressional committees a report on—

subparagraph.text: the range of cyber and asymmetric threats posed to Israel by state and non-state actors; and
the joint efforts of the United States and Israel to address the threats identified in subparagraph (A).

paragraph.text: The report required under paragraph (1) shall be submitted in unclassified form, but may contain a classified annex.
In this subsection, the term appropriate congressional committees means the Committee on Foreign Affairs of the House of Representatives and the Committee on Foreign Relations of the Senate.

attestation-group.attestation-date: Passed the House of Representatives December 11, 2013.
